column4: how can I use ALSA wrapper for oss apps? I dont even know what to download
have you read the alsa howto? alsa-oss is pretty normal these days.
nope.. it maybe pretty normal but im new to linux and trying to get sound in quake running <3
ah-ha. wait one.
wait one second?
yep.
alrighty
I've got this one in a script I use to start quake "quake4 +set s_driver oss  CMI8738MC8 +set s_numberOfSpeakers 2"
I use quake3 though.. would that still work?
http://www.linuxquestions.org/questions/showthread.php?t=260975
the NOT RECOMMENDED bit is what i was looking for. should fix it.
I dont remember if one of those was the same command I tried but when I tried it the sound worked and when I tried to enter a game it would freeze like a screen shot
I mean awhile back..
did you try installing other sound servers like arts etc. ? cause that may also have been why it didn't work.
even the person on there had the same isse
no I havent.. how might I do it?
no don't.
install arts etc.?
throwing more at it isn't the answer it just makes it more messy. part of the problem of 'trying everything'

well I thought the alsa wrapper may help it out cause it sais that same sound error everyone gets and with the help of the wrapper it would allow access to /dev or w/e.. unless you know of another way
am I dead in the water then? are you not there anymore
i'm here but also doing some 'real' work. what's going on?
the q3 no sound? I didnt know you ended the convo.
sorry. thought you were trying the pcmcp0 trick.
